title: Hearing
description:
Difficulties in hearing can limit how well someone detects or interprets sound, from mild hearing loss to total deafness. Communication barriers often arise in noisy or group settings.

Using captions, visual cues, sign language, or assistive devices supports inclusion and equal access to information.

Did you know that there are different sign languages? Singapore uses the Singapore Sign Language (SgSL), which has its own history and unique structure developed from American, Shanghainese, and locally evolved influences. Click here for more information.
